Question: What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You may turn right
You may go straight ahead
You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Question: When following a vehicle on a dusty metal (gravel) road, you should:

Answers.Answer: keep close to the other vehicles
drive down the centre of the road
adjust your speed to suit the conditions
pass the vehicle in front of you

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: When coming up to a Stop sign, where should you stop?

Answers.Answer: With the front wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
With the rear wheels of your vehicle on the yellow lines
Where you can see all vehicles coming from all directions
Where you can only see vehicles coming from your right

Question: You are driving past a line of parked cars. You notice a ball bouncing out into the road ahead. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving at the same speed
Keep driving at the same speed and flash the vehicle’s headlights
Slow down and be prepared to stop for children
Slow down and move to the right-hand side of the road

Question: Can you stop on a bus stop in a private motor vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Only between midnight and 6am
No
When dropping off passengers
Only if it is for less than 5 minutes

Question: A police officer can impound your car on the spot if you are caught driving while disqualified.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Walk to get help
Wave down a passing vehicle
Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: What must you do before turning left into a driveway?

Answers.Answer: Check the driveway is clear and enter
Signal only if there is a vehicle behind you and enter
Signal for 3 seconds or more and if the driveway is clear, enter
Signal only if another vehicle is coming towards you and enter

Question: What are you NOT allowed to do when driving on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Indicate before changing lanes
Pass using the left-hand lane
Pass other vehicles
Pick up hitchhikers

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: You are coming up to a school patrol crossing and both signs are held out. When can you drive on?

Answers.Answer: When both signs have been pulled in
When there are no pedestrians on the crossing
When the sign on your side of the crossing has been pulled in
When there are no pedestrians on your half of the crossing

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign
You may park your vehicle for no longer than 40 minutes from 8am to 6pm on days other than public holidays
You may park your vehicle for longer than 40 minutes if someone stays in it
You may not park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead without stopping
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left

Question: If you have a rear tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout
sway from side to side
increase speed

Question: If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?

Answers.Answer: 1 metre
2 metres
3 metres
4 metres

Question: You are turning right at traffic signals showing a red arrow pointing to the right. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on but give way to all oncoming vehicles
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Drive on straight ahead only if it is safe
Drive on because all oncoming vehicles are stopped

Question: What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?

Answers.Answer: Normal speed limits apply
60km/h
80km/h
90km/h

Question: If you have a front tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout
sway from side to side
slow down

Question: If you have to drive at a slow speed which may hold up other vehicles, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
Make the traffic behind you slow down to the speed that you are driving at
Drive down the middle of the road so that any vehicles behind you can pass on the left

Question: What does ‘the speed limit’ mean?

Answers.Answer: The slowest speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive in good conditions
The average speed you can drive in good conditions
The fastest speed you can drive, except when overtaking

Question: What do these road markings mean?

Answers.Answer: Turning vehicles should enter turning lane at arrows and avoid striped area
Turning vehicles should avoid all road markings and use the left-hand lane
All vehicles can make a U-turn at these road markings
Turning vehicles drive straight over all road markings and wait to turn right

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: Directions from a police officer overrule traffic signals, road signs and give way rules at an intersection.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: You look in the mirror and see a cyclist – what should you do when opening the car door?

Answers.Answer: Open the door and expect the cyclist to stop
Open the door and expect the cyclist to swerve
Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door
Warn the cyclist by sounding the horn before opening the door

Question: What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up within 2 hours
Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely
Sweep it up within 24 hours
Tell a police officer

Question: The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing with a raised traffic island in the middle, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians who are on your half of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Remain stopped until the pedestrian has reached the other side of the road
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all on coming traffic

Question: When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?

25km/h
30km/h
